There was one other sighting in Wilmington on or around June 22nd 2010
divs: sighting detailsthis is re: mufon cases #23924 and #24031 i had no idea how to report a ufo sighting and wasn't even interested. but then i googled wrightsville beach ufo and saw that you had a case report from the same night i saw what i saw. i felt i should chime in. in both cases, the yacht club members and the couple, they were both further away then i was. the yacht club is about a mile from the pier, and the pier is a few hundred yards away from where i was. i was out for a run on the beach and i saw a triangular object rise out of the ocean maybe 150-200 feet away from my spot on the beach. i was scared so i did not approach. it was a pretty dark night, but some stars were out. i could tell it was a solid object because when they orange\red lights in a triangular pattern rose from the water, the space in between the lights blocked out the stars behind it, indicating to me it was a solid object. the object hovered about 50 feet above the water for maybe 10-15 seconds, and then shot off horizontally, then upwards from a dead-stand-still to incredible speeds with no sounds of engine thrust. i walked further down the beach and saw the lights again behind me, over my right shoulder. i saw them for less time, maybe because i had missed them start again, or maybe the duration was simply shorter. i can't much speak to the 2nd incident. i was trying to get down to the end of the beach. no later than 10 minutes later, fighter jets began to fly overhead, and i could hear at least one helicopter. i thought they were looking for whatever i saw. that was my gut reaction. i know you have no reason to believe this almost a year later, but this is what i saw. i will never forget that night, and it was a very scary experience. i want to try to not attach emotions to the report, and i don't want to say it was alien, but it was unidentfied, it was submerged, it flew, and i cannot say what it was. that's a ufo\uso to me.
